definition[0]: a chemical that helps something such as a food to stay in the same state, for example to prevent it from separating into different liquids
definition[1]: a piece of equipment that helps make something such as a plane or ship steady
definition[2]: one of a pair of small wheels that are fastened to the back wheel of a childâ€™s bicycle to prevent it from falling over
definition[3]: one of the ways in which a government tries to prevent large movements in the level of employment, incomes, prices, and production, for example by controlling interest rates, income tax, and government spending
example[0]: Taxes and public spending act as automatic stabilisers in modern economies.
